conclusion: Consider direction of A's movement, arrangement of blocks, potential deflections or collisions.
A is moving from the lower right towards the group of blocks with assumed momentum for collisions.
A will first encounter the red block near the center.
A will likely collide with the red block given its direction.
After hitting the red block, A may be deflected slightly.
Depending on angle and force, A could continue towards the orange block or stack of green blocks.
If A continues towards the orange block, it might collide with it next.
After colliding with the orange block, A might lose enough momentum to stop near this block or be deflected towards the yellow blocks.
Final stop position will depend on cumulative effect of collisions.
A will likely collide with the red block first, followed by the orange block.
A will probably come to a stop near the orange block or be deflected towards the yellow blocks.
